review_title: A wonderful place to be employed
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Ames, IA
pros: I worked at MGMC for about 7 months after graduating from nursing school. I did my preceptor there as well. The environment, the people, and the patients were amazing. Patient load is 6-8 usually 6 at nights. Most of the time, we would not have a lead without patients but that was one of MGMC goals they were working on. Also, the technology was up-to-date. The Chief of Nursing, Cory, constantly shows he cares about his employees and trying to improve MGMC. I am extremely sad to go due to change of location but would recommend this hospital to anyone. I worked on the surgical floor and the amount of teamwork at night was so strong. Also, the benefits were great too!
cons: Understaffed often. Not much management overnight besides house manager.

job_title: Systems Support Specialist in Ames, IA
pros: Great people to work with and they really helped me when I was learning the job. Many of them encouraged me to call them if I had any issues what so ever even when they were off the clock.
cons: HR was very inflexible with me when I was getting hired. I tried to see if I could split up my orientation and do as much as possible on my own due to orientation being scheduled on class days for me, but they didn't give me any room or options besides missing all of my classes that day. In addition to that HR didn't seem to care or sympathize that missing four classes was a big deal for me.

review_title: Support Positions are good for college jobs.
job_title: Food Service Worker in Ames, IA
pros: Benefits were great, time off was fair, it was a great job to have while in college executive team including the CEO and CFO were very approachable.
cons: I worked in a support department in food service so as you can imagine there were people to treat you poorly based on your station. Most of the time people were nice however. My supervisor at the time sat around all day and didn't get his hands dirty, but that was about 5 years ago.

pros: Decent pay for the work. Really great facility! constantly updated and clean. Lots of pride working there. Some of the best, capable and kindest people work there.
cons: Management struggles with keeping people in line. Some of the day shift struggles to be nice... They do not consult staff when updates occur.

pros: Patients can be great! I love most of my coworkers, and I have a pretty good relationship with all of my managers!

review_title: Amazing benefits, great environment of work, and a solid management team that cares for their employees.
pros: IPERS, Health Insurance, the people you work with are kindhearted and team oriented
cons: As it is an Iowa public employer, you cannot get compensation or awarded financially based on your performance. Thus motivation is sometimes an issue for management and some employees.

pros: I worked in the ER and it was the greatest experience I ever had. Great doctors, management, and co-workers. Everyone enjoyed their jobs and kept wanting to come back.
cons: An occasional lack of teamwork and a disconnect between the paramedics and ER staff. No director, just a supervisor. Sometimes hospitalists could get cranky.
